28529.name: weblate integration
28529.description:
a plugin that checks for strings on weblate (translation tool) so design copy is updated with all website relevant locale data.


it integrates weblate self-hosted API to quality check design texts on figma and suggest possible already translated strings.

30187.name: [Alpha] Figma to Abstra converter
30187.description:
Use this plugin to create designs and copy them over directly to Abstra!


This is an open alpha. If you want to know more please contact us.

28099.name: Quick Setup
28099.description: Quick Setup will create a few pages to get your indie project started.

30683.name: Cherry Theme Generator
30683.description:
This is the official Cherry Design System plugin. Please download the design system file from Figma Community in order to generate your Cherry theme design tokens.


Sass

  • Generate the the theme variables for Sass
  • Saves variables as theme.scss
  • Output format:


$screen-sm: 576px;
$color-primary: #f43f5e;
$size-h1-desktop: 40px;


PostCSS

  • Generate the the theme variables for PostCSS
  • Saves variables as theme.css
  • Output format:


@custom-media --screen-sm (min-width: 576px);
:root {
  --color-primary: #f43f5e;
  --size-h1-desktop: 40px;
}


React Components

  • Generate the the JSON theme for React Components using Emotion.js (css-in-js)
  • Saves variables as theme.js
  • Output format:


{
  breakpoints: [0, 576, 768, 992, 1200, 1440, 1920],
  colors: {
    primary: "#f43f5e"
  },
  sizes: {
    h1: {
      size: {
        desktop: "62px"
      }
    }
  }
}


Check out the documentation at: https://cherry.design/

30693.name: VRT
30693.description:
Easily track changes across your entire Figma file and avoid accidentally breaking something.


Step 1: Snapshot your current file

The first thing you'll want to do is set your baseline. This will go through all of your pages and create snapshot images for each of them. If your file has many pages, you can select or deselect individual pages.


Step 2: Go make some changes

Once you've got your baseline snapshots set, go forth and make some changes. For example, you may be curious what will happen if you change a specific color. When you're finished, click 'Take Snapshot'


Step 3: Compare Results

At a glance, pages that have any visually noticeable changes will be shown as failed. The baseline snapshot is compared against the comparision snapshot to produce a diff image. Any changes will be marked red.


------------------------------------


Completely open source.
30693.release_notes:
v1.1.1
* Fixed bug when taking comparisions

30315.name: FeedLabs
30315.description:
The FeedLabs plugin helps you to quickly render a template for many items in an item list. 


How to

1) Create a template (frame), using Figma

2) Upload a CSV file with your items, using the plugin

3) Render the frame for all items in a few seconds


Features

  • Dynamic images; use image URLs to show a different image per item
  • Dynamic text; use fields inside text elements to show different text per item. (e.g. ${{price}},-)
  • Conditional rendering; show an element depending on a certain condition (e.g. 'sale' EQUAL true)
  • Render up to 50 items in a few seconds
  • Make infinite templates and designs, using Figma


FAQ

What is the pricing model?

The plugin in the current state will always be available for free.


What if I want to add more than 50 items?

Currently we only offer a free service, this free service only allows limited features. Soon we are launching a service allowing the processing of more than 100.000s of items.


Something is not working as expected, what do I do?

We love feedback! Please send an email to vanamerongen@squaremoon.nl and I will personally help you.


I need a feature which is not implemented, what do I do?

We are currently working very hard implementing many new features. However, if you have some useful suggestions, please send the to me at vanamerongen@squaremoon.nl.




Powered by SquareMoon B.V.

30856.name: Convert to Variant
30856.description:
Select multiple instances and convert them into variants of their main component, then seamlessly swap the variants into your design.


How to Use

  1. Select 1 or more instances which you have modified from the original component. (it works best if you have named them descriptively as the variant will use this name)
  2. Right click and run the Convert to Variant plugin from your Plugin menu.
  3. Enjoy your new variants, ready for you to reuse elsewhere in your design.
  4. Tidy up your property name, the variations will be created in the first property which defaults to 'Property 1'


Requirements

  • Main Component must be local

30909.name: Ruri â€“ Splines
30909.description:
Create high quality splines, shapes, spots without leaving Figma. Ultimate variations, color schemes.

By ruri.design - your design superpower!

30698.name: Facilitator
30698.description:
Remove awkward moments from your workshops.

Use plugin to:

  • Pick a volunteer
  • Define group's order

30719.name: RICE Prioritization Calculator
30719.description: A small tool that creates uniform RICE prioritization cards for your feature planning.

30086.name: Frontdrop
30086.description:
Messy transition from design to code? we got you.

Import designs from Figma or create your components with our drag and drop editor, set props, animations, and ship them.


Steps:

  1. Design your component in figma
  2. Add frontdropio to your plugins
  3. Select your design and open the plugin

30705.name: Display for role
30705.description:
A plugin that allows managing roles by show-hide function


Prerequisites:

  • Add _roles page to your Figma file
  • Add a list of nodes with the names of your roles on _roles page
  • Plugin will automatically find this list and you can apply them to elements you want
  • Select the parent frame or group and then select the role and click show

31120.name: Interactive components template
31120.description:
Tired of creating the same interaction properties for your component sets?

Use this plugin to turn any element to a component set with 4 predefined basic properties and wired interactions. All you have to do is just add your styles to variants.

30528.name: Lingohub
30528.description:
All your texts in one place - Localize your Figma projects with Lingohub!

 

With Lingohub you localize your projects in no time! Whether they are web or mobile apps, games, or websites. We provide you with continuous translation management and a workflow that is smoothly integrated into your product development process.

 

With our Figma plugin you can easily push your text segments straight from Figma to Lingohub. After your translation has been completed, simply pull the texts directly from Lingohub. Just like that you can view your localized design in Figma.

 

Your translators have an added benefit too, as they are able to check the context of each text segment while translating. Screenshots of your design are automatically uploaded to Lingohub. The days of manually uploading screenshots are over.

 

What can you do with Lingohub?

  • Push and pull your text segments directly from Figma to Lingohub and vice-versa.
  • Different teams working together on localization.
  • Automate your software localization.
  • Translate with our powerful editor.
  • A translation tool you can depend on: term base, translation memory, quality checks, ...

 

For more information on how to use our Figma plugin, visit our Help Center article https://help.lingohub.com/en/.

 

To use the Figma plugin a paid account is required. We provide you with a 14-day free trial where all features are available for you to try. If you need help, feel free to contact our https://lingohub.com/support at any time. Or schedule a free https://lingohub.com/demo and learn all about Lingohub.

30366.name: Setup Zap
30366.description: (MVP) A blazing fast boilerplate generator for UI/UX Designers!

30981.name: Run GitHub Actions workflows
30981.description:
Run GitHub Actions workflows from Figma sending the selected page and all selected nodes as inputs.


Setup for Figma

Setup on Figma is straightforward. You just need to setup a new workflow clicking on the + button. You'll need a GitHub Access Token to run workflows.


After that, you can select a page and one or more nodes from that page and click on â–¶. This will run the selected workflow, passing your selection as workflow' inputs.


Setup for GitHub

Before running a workflow for the first time, you'll need to properly setup a GitHub Actions workflow ğŸ˜ƒ

Checkout a working example from-figma.yaml.


Figma Export PDFs

What do you think about exporting Figma content as PDF to an FTP Server, just clicking a button from Figma? Would it be cool, isn't it?


Take a look at this workflow and find out how this is totally feasible. Just clone the workflow and setup this Figma plugin ğŸ˜‰
